name: WASP-172
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-172 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-172 is a star with 1.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.91 times its radius. It is located 1780.8769911999998 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.79 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-172 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-172 system

WASP-172 b

WASP-172 b was discovered by the SuperWASP-South observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-172 b is 149.3801 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-172 b is 17.598 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-172 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-172 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-172, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP-South.
